title: Joaquin Phoenix and Rooney Mara enjoy casual outing with pals as actor confirms he'd do Joker sequel
text:
They've been dating for three years and confirmed their engagement in July.

And on Tuesday, Joaquin Phoenix and Rooney Mara were spotted meeting up with friends in Los Angeles.

Phoenix, 44, who is riding high on the box office success of his film Joker, smoked a cigarette as he and Mara, 34, said their hellos.

Out and about: Joaquin Phoenix, 44, and Rooney Mara, 34, were spotted meeting up with friends in LA on Tuesday

The couple were dressed down for their outing.

Mara paired a white t-shirt with black jeans and white trainers.

She had a zipper jacket knotted around her waist and carried a cotton shopping bag over one shoulder.

Phoenix opted for a black t-shirt tucked into black jeans belted at the waist and a pair of Converse sneakers.

Casual: Mara paired a white t-shirt with black jeans and white trainers. She had a zipper jacket knotted around her waist and carried a cotton shopping bag over one shoulder

Relaxed: Phoenix opted for a black t-shirt tucked into black jeans belted at the waist and a pair of Converse sneakers and smoked a cigarette

Celebrity couple: The two have been dating for three years and confirmed their engagement in July

Number one movie: Phoenix is riding high on the box office success of his film Joker released last weekend

Joker, another origin story for the DC Comics villain that's directed by Todd Phillips, had the biggest October weekend opening box office ever, pulling in $93.5 million.

When the film first screened at the Venice Film Festival, critics immediately raved about Phoenix's performance and tipped for an Academy Award nomination.

It got a similar response when it was screened shortly afterwards at the Toronto International Film Festival.

On Tuesday, NME.com reported that Phoenix has expressed interest in reprising the role in a sequel.

Speaking to Peter Travers for ABC's Popcorn, the actor said: 'I wouldn’t have thought of this as my dream role. But now, honestly, I can’t stop thinking about it.'

'I talked to Todd a lot about what else we might be able to do, in general, just working together, but also specifically, if there’s something else we can do with Joker that might be interesting,' he added.
description: Phoenix, 44, who is riding high on the box office success of his film Joker, smoked a cigarette as he and Mara, 34, greeted their friends.
